title: What should I print with a 3D printer? I’m open to suggestions. - Quora

response.answer_text: Print stuff you've designed yourself there’s nothing more satisfying. If it's not quite right, tweak it in cad and print again. That's really what these things were designed to do. They're also good at making limited runs of small items. I went to a Christmas Market yesterday in Granada Spain where a 3d printer was on a stall filled with very simple 3d printed objects. It's also very satisfying to replace broken household items like remote control battery covers or bits of plastic trim from your car that would difficult or expensive to get replacements for.

First things you should print are so-called test and tuning prints. Then print accessories for your specific printer that improve its performance and utility. Then print out trinkets and gadgets that catch your attention. While you’re doing all that, try out various free and online 3d modelers and find one that you “get.” Learn as many tricks and methods as you can and start designing things that you can utilize in your home and hobbies.
